sen.j: 本庄 普一、/晋一（ほんじょう ふいち/しんいち、寛政10年（1798年） - 弘化3年10月4日 (旧暦)（1846年11月22日））は、江戸時代後期に本庄宿（現在の埼玉県本庄市）で開業していた蘭学医、文人。
sen.e: Fuichi or Shinichi HONJO (1798 - November 22, 1846) was Rangakui (a doctor who studied Western sciences) and a literary man who opened a medical practice in 本庄宿 (current Honjo City in Saitama Prefecture) in the late Edo period.
sen.cmt: 読み方不明 蘭学医の定訳不明
sen.e: Fuichi or Shinichi HONJO (1798 - November 22, 1846) was a rangakui (a doctor who studied Western sciences by means of the Dutch language) and literate who opened a medical practice in 本庄宿 (current Honjo City in Saitama Prefecture) in the late Edo period.
sen.cmt: ・蘭学医の説明の為にby means of the Dutch languageを追加 ・a literary man を削除し literateに変更しました。
sen.e: Fuichi or Shinichi HONJO (1798 - November 22, 1846) was a rangakui (a doctor who studied Western sciences by means of the Dutch language) and literate who opened a medical practice in 本庄宿 (current Honjo City in Saitama Prefecture) in the late Edo period.

sen.j: 諱を俊篤、字を士雅と称した。
sen.e: His imina (personal name) was 俊篤 and azana (another name) was 士雅.
His imina (personal name) was 俊篤 and azana (another name) was 士雅.
His imina (personal name) was 俊篤 and azana (another name) was 士雅.

sen.j: 本庄宿の医師本庄正俊の次男として本町に生まれ、医師を志し、江戸で沼津藩医の保土田翠蘭に学び、その後、日本、中国、オランダの医学についても幅広く調べ、研究を重ねる。
sen.e: He was born the second boy of Masatoshi HONJO, a doctor in 本庄宿, and he studied under 保土田翠蘭, a doctor of the Numazu Domain in Edo to become a doctor, and after that, he widely educated himself Japanese, Chinese and Dutch medicine, and studied them further.
sen.cmt: He was born the second boy of Masatoshi HONJO, a doctor in 本庄宿, and he studied under 保土田翠蘭, a doctor of the Numazu Domain in Edo to become a doctor, and after that, he widely educated himself Japanese, Chinese and Dutch medicine, and studied them further.
sen.e: He was born as the second son of a doctor : Masatoshi HONJO of 本庄宿 and he studied in Edo under 保土田翠蘭 who was a doctor of the Numazu Domain aiming to become a doctor, after a while, he widely inquired into Japanese, Chinese and Dutch medicine and studied them further.
sen.cmt: ・asを追加 ・boyを削除、sonに変更 ・不要なコンマを少なくする為に：を追加 ・inを削除、ofに変更 ・in Edoの位置を変更 ・志したことを明確にする為にaimingを追加 ・after that を削除、after whileに変更 ・educated himselfを削除、inquired intoに変更しました。
sen.e: He was born as the second son of a doctor : Masatoshi HONJO of 本庄宿 and he studied in Edo under 保土田翠蘭 who was a doctor of the Numazu Domain aiming to become a doctor, after a while, he widely inquired into Japanese, Chinese and Dutch medicine and studied them further.

sen.j: 文政6年（1823年）の時点で「普一」と名乗っており、諸国を遍歴し、各地の名医を訪ね、療法や秘薬の教えを乞い、病人を普（あまね）く救う事を自分の課題として、「普一（病人に普く一灯をともす）」と号したとされる。
sen.e: He referred himself as "Shinichi" in 1823, and as his own challenge, he decided to make a tour of various provinces, visit noted doctors in each place to ask for instruction of medical treatment and secret medicine, and save all patients, therefore it is said that he named himself "Shinichi (kindle a light for all patients)"

He referred himself as "Shinichi" in 1823, because of his own challenge to save all patients by making a tour of various provinces and visiting noted doctors in each place to ask for instruction in medical treatment and secret medicine, therefore it is said that he named himself "Shinichi (kindle a light for all patients)."
sen.cmt: ・コンマを減らす為に文を変更しました。
sen.e: He referred himself as "Shinichi" in 1823, because of his own challenge to save all patients by making a tour of various provinces and visiting noted doctors in each place to ask for instruction in medical treatment and secret medicine, therefore it is said that he named himself "Shinichi (kindle a light for all patients)."

sen.j: また、華岡青洲の乳がん手術図も模写している。
sen.e: He copied out the drawing of breast cancer's operation by Seishu HANAOKA.
He copied out the drawing of an operation for breast cancer performed by Seishu HANAOKA.
sen.cmt: ・内容を明確にする為、文を変更しました。
sen.e: He copied out the drawing of an operation for breast cancer performed by Seishu HANAOKA.

sen.j: 文政8年（1825年）頃、長崎に至り、オランダ医術を学び、フィリップ・フランツ・フォン・シーボルトも治す事ができなかった清人の眼病を手術によって治療し、眼科医として全国的に名声を得る。
sen.e: Around in 1825, he went to Nagasaki to study Dutch medicine and he gained fame as an eye doctor all over the country after he treated 清人's eye disease by operation that Philipp Franz von Siebold were not able to heal.
sen.cmt: 読み方および意味不明
sen.e: In around 1825, he went to Nagasaki to study Dutch medicine and treated 清人's eye disease by performing an operation which was a case Philipp Franz von Siebold were not able to deal with. As a result he gained nationwide fame as an eye doctor.
sen.cmt: ・内容を明確にする為、文を変更しました。
sen.e: In around 1825, he went to Nagasaki to study Dutch medicine and treated 清人's eye disease by performing an operation which was a case Philipp Franz von Siebold were not able to deal with; as a result he gained nationwide fame as an eye doctor.

sen.j: 蘭漢折衷型医術を自分のものとし、京都、川越市など治療の旅を続け、文政10年（1827年）頃、本庄に戻り、内科、外科、眼科を開業。
sen.e: He acquired the skill of 蘭漢折衷型医術, and after the traveling to treat patients in Kyoto City and Kawagoe City and other places, he returned to Honjo around 1827 and opened departments of internal treatment, surgery and ophthalmology.
sen.cmt: 読み方および意味不明
sen.e: acquiring the skill of 蘭漢折衷型医術, After returned to Honjo in around 1827 from his travel to Kyoto City, Kawagoe City and other places to treat patients, he opened departments of internal treatment, surgery and ophthalmology.
sen.cmt: ・簡略にする為に文を変更しました。
sen.e: acquiring the skill of 蘭漢折衷型医術, After returned to Honjo in around 1827 from his travel to Kyoto City, Kawagoe City and other places to treat patients, he opened departments of internal treatment, surgery and ophthalmology.

sen.j: 大勢の門人の指導にあたりながら、文政12年（1829年）に『眼科錦囊（がんか きんのう）』を、天保8年（1837年）には『続眼科錦囊』を刊行した（この本のシリーズは19世紀の眼科医のバイブルとなった）。
sen.e: While he was teaching many disciples, he published "Ganka Kinno" in 1829 and "Zoku Ganka Kinno" in 1837 (This series became the bible of ophthalmology in 19th century).
While he was teaching of many disciples, he published "Ganka Kinno" in 1829 and "Zoku Ganka Kinno" in 1837 (These series of books became the bible of ophthalmology in 19th century).
sen.cmt: ・ofを追加 ・Thisを削除しThese series of booksに変更しました。
sen.e: While he was teaching of many disciples, he published "Ganka Kinno" in 1829 and "Zoku Ganka Kinno" in 1837 (These series of books became the bible of ophthalmology in 19th century).

sen.j: 他にも、『天狗堂脈論』なども著した。
sen.e: In addition to this, he also published "天狗堂脈論."
In addition to this, he also published "天狗堂脈論."
In addition to this, he also published "天狗堂脈論."

sen.j: 交友関係は蘭学者から儒学者まで幅広く、忍藩の儒者芳川波山とは江戸遊学時より親交を重ねる間柄であった。
sen.e: He had a large circle of friends from Dutch scholars to Confusion scholars, and he had maintained friendly relationship with a Confucian Hasan YOSHIKAWA since their traveling to study in Edo.
He had a large circle of friends from Dutch scholars to Confusion scholars and maintained friendly relationship with a Confucian Hasan YOSHIKAWA of Oshi Domain since he traveled to study in Edo.

sen.e: He had a large circle of friends from Dutch scholars to Confusion scholars and maintained friendly relationship with a Confucian Hasan YOSHIKAWA of Oshi Domain since he traveled to study in Edo.

sen.j: また、漢詩文にも精通していた。
sen.e: He was also well versed in Chinese poem and Chinese passage.
He was also well versed in Chinese poem and Chinese passage.
He was also well versed in Chinese poem and Chinese passage.

sen.j: 弘化3年（1846年）2月に本庄で大火が起こり、焼き出された為、児玉郡八幡町に借家し、同年11月に49歳で没し、同所、浄眼寺にて葬られる。
sen.e: Since great fire occurred in Honjo and he was burned out in February, 1846, he rent a house in Yahata chow, Kodama gun, however, he died at the age of 49 in November in the same year, and then he was buried in Jogan-ji Temple in the same place.
sen.cmt: 八幡町の読み方不明 【一応読める範囲で訳を入れました】
sen.e: Because he was burned out by the great fire occurred in Honjo in February 1846, he had to rent a house in Yahata Town, Kodama District. However in the same year, he died at the age of 49 in November and then he was buried in Jogan-ji Temple in the same district.
sen.cmt: ・火事焼け出され家を借りた事を明確にする為に文を変更しました。

sen.j: 養子である本庄俊圭（1826年 - 没年不詳）が文人医師として後を継いでいる。
sen.e: His adopted son 本庄俊圭 (1826 - year of death unknown) took over him as a doctor who was well versed in literature.

sen.j: シーボルトも治す事ができなかった眼病を手術によって治療した功績を持ちながらも、普一に関する資料は少なく、謎が多い医者の一人でもある。
sen.e: Although he had a great achievement in curing eye disease by operation that Siebold couldn't heal, there are few materials concerning Shinichi and he is one of the mysterious doctors.

sen.j: のちに眼科医として名声をはせたが、華岡青洲の「乳がん手術図」を模写している事からも分かるように、「病人に普く一灯をともす（普一）」の思想の下、あらゆる分野の医術を学んでいた事が分かる。
sen.e: Later he won fame as an eye doctor, however, as can be seen from the fact that he copied out "the drawing of breast cancer's operation" by Seishu HANAOKA, we can understand that he studied all fields of medical science under the policy "kindle a light for all patients."

sen.j: 『眼科錦囊』には、眼球の解剖図が載っており、角膜や水晶液、水晶膜、視神経などなど各部位の名が見られ、近代医術（眼球の手術）に必要な知識が備わっていた事が分かる（『続眼科錦囊』には眼球の手術の様子が描かれている）。
sen.e: In "Ganka Kinno", anatomical drawing of eyeball and the name of each part such as cornea, crystalline humor, 水晶膜 (membrane of crystalline, and optic nerve were seen and we can understand that he had the necessary knowledge of modern medicine (operation of eyeball) (in "Zoku Ganka Kinno", operation of eyeball was described).
